title: Another 33 trains cancelled today
byline: A total of 33 train services will be cancelled today due to the absence of train drivers and driver assistants, the Railways Department said.

title: Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith casts his vote
byline: Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith cast his vote at Carey College, Colombo. He urged the people to cast their vote.

title: First election results to be released by 10 p.m.
byline: The first election results of the 2024 parliamentary elections will be released by 10 p.m. today, Commissioner General of Elections Saman Sri Ratnayake said.

title: Special Election Joint Disaster Operating Unit to respond to any emergency during polling day
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) and the Election Commission are implementing a special joint mechanism to manage disruptions during election week, the DMC announced yesterday.

title: Police, military on high alert for today’s General Election
byline: As the country prepares for today’s general election, law enforcement authorities have mobilized a massive security operation to ensure a peaceful and orderly process.

title: Sri Lanka’s rupee to remain on a ‘very comfortable terrain’ in coming years: SLBA
byline: Sri Lanka’s rupee is projected to remain on a ‘very comfortable terrain’ in the coming years, with the gross foreign exchange reserves standing to top the US $ 12 billion mark before the capital repayments to the creditors begin in 2029, according to a top banker.

title: JICA plans new support for Sri Lanka’s estate sector
byline: Sri Lanka’s estate sector community is likely to receive significant multinational support, with the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) looking to extend its assistance to improve the social and economic conditions of the estate communities.

title: 10 trains cancelled, 22 train services will not operate tomorrow
byline: At least ten train services will be cancelled tomorrow due to the absence of train drivers and driver assistants, the Railways Department said.

title: Polling closes for general elections; counting to begin
byline: Polling stations closed for the 2024 Parliamentary Elections and counting of vote is to begin soon.

title: Police officer, two election officials die on election day
byline: Three individuals, including a police officer and two election officials, have died suddenly while on duty during election day.

title: General Election: Voter turnout in key districts exceeds 55%
byline: Voter turnout for the 2024 General Election is strong in many districts with more than 55 percent of people casting their votes in some areas by 2:00 p.m. today.

title: Bus-van collision leaves three dead, 39 injured
byline: A collision between a private bus and van on the Dambulla - Mahiyanganaya Road has killed three and injured 39 individuals, police said.

title: NPP wins Ratnapura District with 24, 776 postal votes
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) gained victory in the postal vote result of the Ratnapura District securing 24, 776 votes.

title: NPP leads Galle district with 32,296 postal votes
byline: The postal vote result of the Galle District in the 2024 General Election has been released and the National People’s Power (NPP) has received the highest number of postal votes in the district with a total of 32,296 postal votes.

title: 51 including two candidates arrested over election law violations
byline: Some 51 individuals including two candidates have been arrested so far in connection with election law violations, police said.

title: Strong parliament sufficient, two-thirds led to enactment of laws detrimental to people: President
byline: Claiming that the two-thirds majority was used by political forces to enact laws detrimental to the people, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today the government was expecting only a strong parliament.

title: Ranil predicts low voter turnout at general elections
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe said that enthusiasm for the general elections was visibly low, which could create uncertainly.

title: Over 400 polls-related complaints during last 24 hours
byline: A total of 462 fresh complaints related to the General Elections were received during the last 24 hours, taking the total number of complaints to over 3,800.

title: Six fishermen arrested with 60 kgs of narcotics on high seas
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy arrested six suspects along with 60 kgs of narcotics on a local multi-day fishing trawler during a special operation on the high seas west of Sri Lanka.

title: Transport of ballot boxes delayed at Isipathana College polling station
byline: No buses had reportedly arrived for an hour and a half at the Isipathana College polling station to transport the ballot boxes to the counting centres.

title: Vedda deputy leader, family refuses to vote
byline: The deputy leader of the Vedda Community in Dambana, Gunbandiya Ettho and his family refrained from casting their votes and returned home after they were refused entry into the polling booth with the hand axe on their shoulders.

title: ’’Jivon did not die by suicide’’ Justice for Jivon - Jivon’s family clarifies
byline: The tragic death of Jivon Zoro Singh, a bright 15-year-old boy from a leading international school, who mysteriously fell to his death at the Altair building, has sparked much controversy and speculation on all forms of media including parents and children.
